senses.definition: someone who murders an important person

examples.text: Kennedy’s assassin is assumed to have been Lee Harvey Oswald.
examples.translation: 暗杀肯尼迪的人据说是李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德。

etymology.meaning: ‘one who smokes hashish (and then kills religious enemies)’

extra_examples.text: Although the assassins were never caught, it is commonly believed that they were working for the government.
His assassins must have been aware of his security arrangements.
Professional assassins are going to stab somebody over and over again and leave all this evidence besides?
The assassin had planned to shoot Park in the lobby of the theater, but failed to get an unobstructed view.
The danger from the footpad, the silent assassin, was always present, here in his church or across the river.
The would-be assassin was a member of the presidential bodyguard and of the elite Revolutionary Guard.
Whoever had sent these assassins had completely underestimated the fat knight.

entries.definition: someone who has deliberately killed another person
examples: Do you think the police will ever catch her murderer?
A convicted murderer was on the run last night after escaping from Lewes prison.
In prison he enjoyed reading biographies of other mass murderers.

entries.definition: someone who deliberately kills someone else - used especially in newspapers
examples: The victim's best friend, Joanne, is convinced the killer is local.
The judge described him as "a cold-blooded killer".
Police are searching for the killer of a 9 year old boy.

entries.definition: someone who kills a famous or important person, sometimes because someone else has paid them to do it
examples: Although the assassins were never caught, it is commonly believed that they were working for the government.
His assassins must have been aware of his security arrangements.

entries.definition: someone who is paid to kill people illegally
examples: The hitman used the top floor room of a hotel opposite the square.
The police believe the murder could be the work of a contract killer.

entries.definition: someone who has a mental illness that makes them kill people
examples: Dr Green said that, in his opinion, Perry was a dangerous psychopath who might kill again.
